section.name: InfoQuiver
section.p: InfoQuiver will be a server demon, which supports automatic querying and indexing of many kinds of information datasources. It will include build-in support for most diverse information formats and protocols as well as report generation and -dispatching. InfoQuiver fetches content from defined content sources, stores it in its metaformat in a database, adds the content per client to a lucene full-text search index and will run user defined searches on the stored and indexed content.
Searchresults will be produced in the form of customizable reports and dispatched for each user, usergroup or client.

Most of usual transports (HTTP and HTTPS, FTP and SFTP, WEBDAV, SOAP and XML-RPC, POP, IMAP, SMPT, local file system, CIFS...) and formats (HTML, RSS, PDF as well as various open XML dialects and office formats) are discussed to become medium-term to support.

InfoQuiver runs on a lot of plattforms as well as with nearly every common database system. It uses Torque as persistence layer with a simplified and powerful, cluster aware caching solution. Full-text search is build on top of Jakarta Lucene supplemented with extensions for:
pdf documents (build on top of PDFBox)
MS Word .doc documents
MS Excel .xls documents
rss, opml and atom feeds (thanks to Informa)
raw xml documents
binary data as well as multipart/mixed
As for the moment InfoQuiver is in an early development stage even if the core services do already work very well.
